availability.p: This image and transcription is publicly accessible. The image appears courtesy of the repository named in the Source Description. The transcription and annotation were undertaken by Kentucky Historical Society staff, volunteers, and interns. If referencing this document title, accession number, and permanent URL.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition
Early Access

msIdentifier.repository: Kentucky Department for Libraries and Archives
msIdentifier.collection: Office of the Governor, Beriah Magoffin: Governor's Official Correspondence File, Civil Appointments, 1859-1862

creation.placeName: New York, New York County, New York

body.p:
State of New York, City
and County of New York } SS

I Charles Nettleton of the City, County and State of New York duly appointed by the Governor of the State of Kentucky a Commissioner within and for the State of New York resident in said City of New York do solemnly swear that I will well and truly execute and perform all the duties of such Commissioner under and by virtue of the laws of said State of Kentucky
State, City and County of New York, SS.

Be it remembered that on this 22d day of April in the year one thousand Eight hundred and Sixty one before me Alex. Ostrander a Commissioner of the State of Kentucky within and for the State of New York duly commissioned and sworn and residing in said City of New York, personally appeared Charles Nettleton who subscribed the above affidavit in my presence and made solemn oath to the same before me. In witness whereof I have hereunto set my hand and affixed my official Seal the day and year aforesaid.

figure.ab:
ALEX. OSTRANDER
COMMISSIONER
FOR
Kentucky
CITY, COUNTY, & STATE OF NEW YORK

body.p:
Alex. Ostrander
Commissioner for
Kentucky
in New York --

New York
Comr. of Deeds
Oath
Chas. Nettleton
Filed Sept 23d 1861
